title: idea: amputate helper/procedure
body:
Came up in a chat with @effigies and @franklin-feingold

Given a dataset, produce a derivative dataset which

- would have only the files (directoris, subdatasets) I care about
- be fully YODA compliant (eg `sourcedata/` points to original dataset, history of modification is preserved etc)
- doesn't have shared git history with the original one, and `git-annex` branch contains only information about the keys of relevance
- has operation and resultant dataset "rerunnable" 

I think could be implemented via a helper which would have two stages of operation:

- `stage 1` 
  - create a new dataset
  - install original one as subdataset (e.g. under `sourcedata`)
- `stage 2` - interfaced as `datalad amputate --only-stage2 ...`
  - add original dataset as a remote (e.g. `original`)
  - populate current tree with tree from the `original/master` (we do that for `incoming-preprocessed` by crawler from `incoming`)
  - rm all files which you don't need
  - `git add` the rest (explicit to have stage 2 `datalad re-run`able)
  - git remote --remove original
  - do `git-annex forget` (and may be other extra steps) 

Then
- `datalad amptutate` internally does both stages (unless --only-stage2) while running `stage1; datalad.run(stage2)`

This would result in a dataset which could be `datalad rerun` to re-amputate (e.g. sourcedata/ has changed) while keeping proper RUNCMD commits etc.

For datasets which are super-datasets, it would need to just do it while traversing the hierarchy of subdatsets bottom up, not bothering instantiating datasets which are "amputated".
